meanings.definition: Fail to carry out a plan or intention successfully.
meanings.sent1: I always miscarry my attempts to wake up early.
meanings.sent2: She tends to miscarry her promises to call me back.
meanings.sent3: It's like my plans and I are playing a game of tag, and my plans always manage to tag me first.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of becoming a famous singer miscarry every time she steps on stage.
meanings.sent5: The project's success miscarrying left a lasting impression on the team.

meanings.definition: Suffer a miscarriage, especially of a fetus.
meanings.sent1: She sadly had to miscarry her pregnancy due to complications.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the risks of miscarrying during the first trimester.
meanings.sent3: The poor rabbit miscarrying its litter was a sad sight.
meanings.sent4: The fragile hope of new life can easily miscarry in the harsh wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The mother's heart broke when she had to miscarry her unborn child.
